question.text: Which of the following event occurs during the depolarization phase of an action potential in the neuronal membrane?

options.text: <math><mtext>K+</mtext></math>  ions rapidly move outside the cell
<math><mtext>Na+</mtext></math> ions rapidly move inside the cell
<math><mtext>Na+</mtext></math>  ions rapidly move outside the cell
<math><mtext>K+</mtext></math>  ions rapidly move inside the cell

solution.text: During depolarization, the voltage-gated <math><mtext>Na</mtext><mo>+</mo></math> channel opens due to the arrival of signal or action potential. This leads to the rapid movement of <math><mtext>Na</mtext><mo>+</mo></math> ions from an outside extracellular fluid (ECF) to inside axoplasm as the concentration of <math><mtext>Na</mtext><mo>+</mo></math> ions is more on outside or ECF. This leads to developing a net positive charge inside and net positive charge outside the axonal membrane.
